name: Eleanor Vance
primary_medical_condition: Severe Liver Impairment (Cirrhosis, Child-Pugh C)
other_relevant_medical_history: History of chronic hepatitis C, portal hypertension, occasional ascites. No known drug allergies.
notes: Currently managed with diuretics and careful fluid balance. Any new medication needs strict liver function monitoring.

name: Marcus Chen
primary_medical_condition: Acute Narrow-Angle Glaucoma (recently diagnosed, prior attack)
other_relevant_medical_history: Mild hypertension, controlled with a single agent. No other ocular history of note. Family history of glaucoma.
notes: Requires immediate consultation with ophthalmology for any new drug consideration due to risk of increased intraocular pressure.

name: Isabella Rossi
primary_medical_condition: Active Gastrointestinal Ulceration (duodenal ulcer, confirmed by endoscopy)
other_relevant_medical_history: History of NSAID use for chronic back pain. Currently on a PPI. No known allergies.
notes: Requires careful consideration for any medication that might irritate the GI tract or increase bleeding risk.

name: David Miller
primary_medical_condition: Uncontrolled Autoimmune Disease (Systemic Lupus Erythematosus - active flare with nephritis)
other_relevant_medical_history: On high-dose corticosteroids, history of recurrent infections. Requires close monitoring of kidney function.
notes: Immunosuppressive status and active autoimmune flare make many drugs contra-indicated or require extreme caution.

name: Sofia Rodriguez
primary_medical_condition: End-Stage Renal Disease (ESRD), not yet on dialysis
other_relevant_medical_history: Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus (well-controlled with diet), history of congestive heart failure (compensated). Multiple drug allergies.
notes: Severely impaired kidney function necessitates extreme caution with renally cleared drugs or those impacting fluid/electrolyte balance.

name: John Davies
primary_medical_condition: Active Malignancy (Stage IV Non-Small Cell Lung Carcinoma)
other_relevant_medical_history: Currently undergoing chemotherapy. History of deep vein thrombosis (DVT) with associated anticoagulant use.
notes: Any new drug must be evaluated for interaction with chemotherapy and potential to promote tumor growth or interfere with oncological treatment.

name: Anya Sharma
primary_medical_condition: History of Severe Thrombosis (recurrent PE, factor V Leiden mutation)
other_relevant_medical_history: On long-term oral anticoagulant therapy (Warfarin). No known allergies.
notes: High risk of bleeding and/or further thrombotic events. Drugs affecting coagulation or platelet function are contraindicated or require careful monitoring.

name: Robert Wilson
primary_medical_condition: Severe Cardiac Disease (Decompensated Heart Failure with LVEF 20%, frequent arrhythmias)
other_relevant_medical_history: History of multiple myocardial infarctions. On multiple cardiac medications.
notes: Extremely fragile cardiac status; drugs impacting heart rate, rhythm, contractility, or fluid balance are highly risky.

name: Lena Kuznetsov
primary_medical_condition: Severe Psychosis (Schizophrenia, currently unstable with active hallucinations)
other_relevant_medical_history: On multiple antipsychotic medications. History of paradoxical reactions to sedatives.
notes: Mental status can be profoundly affected by CNS-acting drugs, requiring careful selection to avoid exacerbating symptoms or dangerous interactions.

name: Chen Wei
primary_medical_condition: Myasthenia Gravis (generalized form, stable on Pyridostigmine)
other_relevant_medical_history: History of respiratory crises due to myasthenia. No known allergies.
notes: Medications that affect neuromuscular transmission or muscle strength are severely contraindicated due to risk of respiratory depression and exacerbation of weakness.

name: Michael Carter
primary_medical_condition: Uncontrolled Hypertension (systolic pressure consistently above 160 mmHg)
other_relevant_medical_history: History of stage 1 hypertension, but has been non-compliant with medication. No other cardiac history.
notes: Requires immediate blood pressure management. New drugs must be carefully screened for those that could raise blood pressure or cause a hypertensive crisis.

name: Jessica Lee
primary_medical_condition: Severe Allergic Reaction to Photosensitizing Drugs (confirmed reaction to a tetracycline-class antibiotic)
other_relevant_medical_history: History of a severe, blistering rash and photosensitivity after sun exposure. Known drug allergies include penicillin.
notes: Extreme caution is required for any drug that may increase sun sensitivity or have a similar chemical structure to known allergens.

name: Samuel Johnson
primary_medical_condition: Active Systemic Infection (Streptococcal bacteremia, blood cultures positive)
other_relevant_medical_history: Chronic kidney disease (Stage 3). Recently hospitalized for a non-related issue.
notes: Any new drug with immunosuppressive properties is absolutely contraindicated until the infection is cleared. The patient's compromised kidney function also limits many drug choices.

name: Maria Sanchez
primary_medical_condition: Active Internal Bleeding (upper gastrointestinal bleed, requiring transfusion)
other_relevant_medical_history: History of chronic NSAID use for arthritis. No known clotting disorders.
notes: All anticoagulant, antiplatelet, or GI-irritating drugs are immediately contraindicated. Any new medication must not increase bleeding risk.

name: Alex Petrov
primary_medical_condition: Chronic Dehydration (due to an unrelated medical condition)
other_relevant_medical_history: Healthy otherwise. No known drug allergies.
notes: Any medication that affects fluid balance, especially diuretics or those that could cause further fluid loss, should be avoided or used with extreme caution.

name: Lisa Kim
primary_medical_condition: Severe Hypersensitivity to Aerosolized Agents (diagnosed with a severe, immediate asthmatic response)
other_relevant_medical_history: Severe asthma requiring daily inhalers. History of reactions to certain chemical fragrances and airborne particles.
notes: Inhaled drugs must be evaluated for their potential to trigger a bronchospastic reaction. The patient is at high risk for a severe respiratory event.

name: Frank Chen
primary_medical_condition: Chronic Atrial Fibrillation with a history of embolic stroke.
other_relevant_medical_history: Stable on anticoagulants and a rate-control medication. Mild renal insufficiency.
notes: Requires careful screening for drugs that could affect heart rate, prolong the QT interval, or interact with his anticoagulant therapy.

name: Susan White
primary_medical_condition: Severe Hypothyroidism (Hashimoto's thyroiditis)
other_relevant_medical_history: On a stable dose of thyroid replacement hormone. History of osteoporosis.
notes: Any new drug needs to be checked for potential interactions that could alter thyroid hormone absorption or metabolism.

name: George Davis
primary_medical_condition: Benign Prostatic Hyperplasia (BPH) with urinary retention.
other_relevant_medical_history: No other significant medical history.
notes: Drugs with anticholinergic effects or those that could increase bladder pressure should be avoided to prevent worsening of urinary retention.

name: Helen Garcia
primary_medical_condition: Parkinson's Disease with motor fluctuations.
other_relevant_medical_history: On multiple dopaminergic medications. History of orthostatic hypotension.
notes: Extreme caution is needed for drugs that block dopamine receptors or cause sedation, as these can worsen motor symptoms and hypotension.

name: Carl Jones
primary_medical_condition: Uncontrolled Diabetes Mellitus (Type 2, A1C > 9.0%).
other_relevant_medical_history: History of diabetic neuropathy and peripheral arterial disease.
notes: Any new drug needs to be checked for interactions that could affect blood glucose levels or exacerbate his cardiovascular issues.

name: Linda Brown
primary_medical_condition: History of Osteosarcoma (successfully treated 10 years ago).
other_relevant_medical_history: Currently healthy, with no signs of recurrence. On a calcium and vitamin D supplement.
notes: Extreme caution is needed for any drug that promotes bone growth or cellular proliferation, as this could potentially lead to a recurrence of the malignancy.

name: Henry Wilson
primary_medical_condition: End-Stage Liver Disease (on liver transplant waiting list).
other_relevant_medical_history: History of chronic alcohol use. Severe portal hypertension.
notes: Liver metabolism is severely compromised. Any new medication must have a non-hepatic clearance pathway.

name: Elizabeth Taylor
primary_medical_condition: Severe Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD) with frequent exacerbations.
other_relevant_medical_history: History of smoking. On multiple inhaled bronchodilators and steroids.
notes: Drugs that can cause respiratory depression or fluid retention should be strictly avoided.

name: Thomas Green
primary_medical_condition: Severe Uncontrolled Hypertension (hypertensive crisis last month).
other_relevant_medical_history: On multiple antihypertensive agents.
notes: Any drug that affects blood pressure, especially those with vasoconstrictive properties, is extremely dangerous for this patient.

name: Alex Rodriguez
primary_medical_condition: Uncontrolled Allergic Rhinitis (severe hay fever).
other_relevant_medical_history: Mild, intermittent asthma. Uses a rescue inhaler.
notes: Avoidance of drugs that can cause bronchospasm or have a drying effect on mucous membranes is crucial.

name: Maya Singh
primary_medical_condition: Severe Seizure Disorder (refractory to two medications).
other_relevant_medical_history: Currently on two antiepileptic drugs.
notes: Any new drug must be carefully screened for its potential to lower the seizure threshold or interact with her existing medications.

name: Noah Williams
primary_medical_condition: Hypophosphatemic Rickets.
other_relevant_medical_history: On phosphate and vitamin D supplements.
notes: Any drug that affects calcium or phosphate metabolism, or that could lead to renal calcification, should be avoided.

name: Emily Jones
primary_medical_condition: Uncontrolled Asthma.
other_relevant_medical_history: History of multiple ER visits for asthma exacerbations.
notes: Inhaled drugs must be tested for potential to induce bronchospasm. Avoid systemic drugs that could worsen asthma.

name: Leo Kim
primary_medical_condition: Attention-Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD).
other_relevant_medical_history: History of mild anxiety. Not currently on medication.
notes: Stimulant-type drugs should be introduced with caution due to the anxiety history. Any drug that affects CNS function needs careful titration.

name: Baby Boy Smith
primary_medical_condition: Hyperbilirubinemia (jaundice).
other_relevant_medical_history: Full-term infant, delivered vaginally. No other significant issues.
notes: Drugs that displace bilirubin from albumin, or that are cleared by the immature liver, must be avoided to prevent kernicterus.

name: Baby Girl Johnson
primary_medical_condition: Suspected Neonatal Sepsis.
other_relevant_medical_history: Full-term infant, currently on broad-spectrum antibiotics.
notes: Any drug with immunosuppressive effects is absolutely contraindicated. Drugs with significant renal clearance must be used cautiously due to immature kidney function.

name: Baby A. (Preterm)
primary_medical_condition: Respiratory Distress Syndrome (RDS) with a Patent Ductus Arteriosus (PDA).
other_relevant_medical_history: Undergoing mechanical ventilation.
notes: Drugs that affect prostaglandins or blood vessel constriction are extremely high risk. NSAIDs, in particular, must be avoided due to the PDA.

name: Baby B. (Preterm)
primary_medical_condition: Necrotizing Enterocolitis (NEC).
other_relevant_medical_history: Currently receiving total parenteral nutrition (TPN).
notes: Drugs that affect gastrointestinal motility, blood flow to the gut, or are cleared by the immature liver/kidneys are contraindicated.

name: Baby C. (Preterm)
primary_medical_condition: Intraventricular Hemorrhage (IVH).
other_relevant_medical_history: Stable, but requires close neurological monitoring.
notes: Drugs that affect cerebral blood flow, cause bleeding, or alter clotting are absolutely contraindicated due to the risk of re-bleeding.

name: Liam Chen
primary_medical_condition: Chronic Inflammatory Bowel Disease (Crohn's disease).
other_relevant_medical_history: Currently on an immunosuppressant. Has a history of frequent stomach pain.
notes: Any new drug with GI-irritating properties is to be avoided. Drugs that further suppress the immune system are high risk.
